ConsensuSV-pipeline

Contents:

  • API Reference
ConsensuSV-pipeline
  • »
  • align_genome
  • View page source

align_genome¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

MergeFastq

Class responsible for merging the files in case the sequencing output contains of multiple R1 and R2 files.

QCAnalysis

Class responsible for doing quality control on the merged files.

AlignGenome

Class responsible for aligning the sample to reference genome.

ConvertToBam

Class responsible for converting the aligned sample to bam file format.

SortBam

Class responsible for sorting the bam file.

IndexBam

Class responsible for indexing the sorted bam file.

MarkDuplicates

Class responsible for marking duplicates using bammarkduplicates. Indexes the output as well.

BaseRecalibrator

Class responsible for base recalibration using gatk.

ApplyBQSR

Class responsible for applying BQSR (Base Quality Score recalibration) using gatk.

SortFinal

Class responsible for final sorting.

IndexFinal

Class responsible for final indexing.

Get1000G

Class responsible for getting 9 high-quality NYGC from the ftp servers. Because of the FTP server connection issues, it is done sequentially.

PerformAlignment

Class ending the alignment step, cleaning up the intermediate files, leaving only final, sorted and indexed alignemnt file.
class align_genome.MergeFastq(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: luigi.Task

Class responsible for merging the files in case the sequencing output contains of multiple R1 and R2 files.

resources¶

Resources used by the task.

working_dir¶

Working directory of the task.

file_name_1¶

Name of the file containing R1 reads.

file_name_2¶

Name of the file containing R2 reads.

sample_name¶

Name of the sample.

output(self)¶

The output that this Task produces.

The output of the Task determines if the Task needs to be run–the task is considered finished iff the outputs all exist. Subclasses should override this method to return a single Target or a list of Target instances.

Implementation note

If running multiple workers, the output must be a resource that is accessible by all workers, such as a DFS or database. Otherwise, workers might compute the same output since they don’t see the work done by other workers.

See Task.output

run(self)¶

The task run method, to be overridden in a subclass.

See Task.run

class align_genome.QCAnalysis(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: luigi.Task

Class responsible for doing quality control on the merged files.

Name of the sample.

requires(self)¶

The Tasks that this Task depends on.

A Task will only run if all of the Tasks that it requires are completed. If your Task does not require any other Tasks, then you don’t need to override this method. Otherwise, a subclass can override this method to return a single Task, a list of Task instances, or a dict whose values are Task instances.

See Task.requires

output(self)¶

The output that this Task produces.

The output of the Task determines if the Task needs to be run–the task is considered finished iff the outputs all exist. Subclasses should override this method to return a single Target or a list of Target instances.

Implementation note

If running multiple workers, the output must be a resource that is accessible by all workers, such as a DFS or database. Otherwise, workers might compute the same output since they don’t see the work done by other workers.

See Task.output

class align_genome.Get1000G(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: luigi.Task

Class responsible for getting 9 high-quality NYGC from the ftp servers. Because of the FTP server connection issues, it is done sequentially.

resources¶

Resources used by the task.

working_dir¶

Working directory of the task.

ftp_link = ftp://ftp.1000genomes.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/ftp/data_collections/hgsv_sv_discovery/data¶
samples_ftp¶
requires(self)¶

The Tasks that this Task depends on.

A Task will only run if all of the Tasks that it requires are completed. If your Task does not require any other Tasks, then you don’t need to override this method. Otherwise, a subclass can override this method to return a single Task, a list of Task instances, or a dict whose values are Task instances.

See Task.requires

output(self)¶

The output that this Task produces.

The output of the Task determines if the Task needs to be run–the task is considered finished iff the outputs all exist. Subclasses should override this method to return a single Target or a list of Target instances.

Implementation note

If running multiple workers, the output must be a resource that is accessible by all workers, such as a DFS or database. Otherwise, workers might compute the same output since they don’t see the work done by other workers.

See Task.output

run(self)¶

The task run method, to be overridden in a subclass.

See Task.run

class align_genome.PerformAlignment(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: luigi.Task

Class ending the alignment step, cleaning up the intermediate files, leaving only final, sorted and indexed alignemnt file.

Resources used by the task.

Working directory of the task.

file_name_1¶

file_name_2¶

sample_name¶

Name of the sample.

train_1000g¶

Information whether the current task is part of 1000G benchmarking pipeline.

output(self)¶

The output that this Task produces.

The output of the Task determines if the Task needs to be run–the task is considered finished iff the outputs all exist. Subclasses should override this method to return a single Target or a list of Target instances.

Implementation note

If running multiple workers, the output must be a resource that is accessible by all workers, such as a DFS or database. Otherwise, workers might compute the same output since they don’t see the work done by other workers.

See Task.output

run(self)¶

The task run method, to be overridden in a subclass.

See Task.run

requires(self)¶

The Tasks that this Task depends on.

A Task will only run if all of the Tasks that it requires are completed. If your Task does not require any other Tasks, then you don’t need to override this method. Otherwise, a subclass can override this method to return a single Task, a list of Task instances, or a dict whose values are Task instances.
